file_content.text: General, I'm on Tatooine. Has Master Kiwiiks reported in?
No, and after what happened on Alderaan....
Negative--and before I brief you any further, I'd like to make something clear.
Master Satele informed me of her decision regarding Kira. I don't approve.
The Jedi Council may trust your Padawan, but that doesn't mean I have to.
Kira's loyal. I guarantee you'll change your opinion of her.
She'll earn your trust.
Or not. Let's keep his options open.
No one expects blind faith from you, General.
That's your right.
Although a little might be nice.
Hmph. Let's get on with this.
For the record, I don't trust her either.
I feel the same way.
I'm standing right here.
And you're blasted lucky to be, so don't push it.
Last we heard, Kiwiiks secured our weapons research facility. She's missed every comm check since then.
Enemy action is the most likely scenario, but on Tatooine, anything's possible.
Aside from the heat, what could be so deadly here?
It's only a desert.
If it's so dangerous, why pick it for your weapons facility?
Why locate the project here?
Tatooine has millions of uninhabited kilometers. Perfect for our research.
I hope it's as lawless as Nar Shaddaa.
My kind of place.
Outside the main settlements, the only laws are those of the wild.
People vanish there all the time. Some are lost to the native Sand People, others to natural predators. The rest... who knows?
Doctor Godera will brief you on the weapons project. Doctor?
Doctor Godera's finally up to speed on our projects. Doctor?
The research facility on Tatooine has created a device code-named the "Shock Drum."
The weapon discharges massive ultrasonic vibrations into the ground. It damages enemy fortifications at a microscopic level--quite literally softening them up.
Sustained ultrasonic damage = highly destructive to droid parts
The vibrations will cripple people if they're close enough. But that's not all.
The Shock Drum eventually disrupts the planetary core. At critical mass, the core explodes.
A weapon so destructive has no place in the Republic arsenal.
That's terrible.
We only recently discovered its full capabilities. I banned further testing.
Were you planning to destroy Tatooine?
You were testing that here?
Of course not. When we discovered this potential, we immediately stopped testing.
Imagine what that weapon could do to the Imperial homeworld.
We can eliminate the Empire.
My sentiments exactly.
We're not in the business of destroying worlds. When the weapon's full potential became known, I halted testing.
However, there's a fully operational Shock Drum prototype at our facility. If Darth Angral has captured it, the results will be catastrophic.
With no word from the facility or Master Kiwiiks, we must assume the worst.
I sense Master Kiwiiks through the Force, but it's faint... I think she's dying.
Control your emotions, Kira. Don't give in to fear.
Calm yourself, Padawan.
I'm not afraid, but she can't die. I owe her too much.
Can you feel her surroundings? Where is she?
Do you sense her location?
Not sure... somewhere dark. It's taking everything she has to stay alive.
Master Kiwiiks is strong. The Shock Drum's our top priority.
She's on her own.
I don't have any Republic contacts there to assist you. You're on your own.
Our facility is located in a remote part of the desert... I'm transmitting the coordinates.
Good luck--Var Suthra out.
